Culinary Profile & Uses

1. Flavour and Form ‘Neri-Snack’ offers an intensely sweet, clean marine flavor with subtle mineral notes and a firm, satisfying crunch. The meat is small but powerfully flavored, concentrating the essence of the ocean in a single bite. The texture is crisp yet tender - similar to a high-quality tiny clam. The shells are the standout feature: glossy with dramatic, alternating black and golden-yellow stripes that remain vibrant even after cooking, creating stunning visual appeal.

2. The Ultimate Edible Garnish This nerite’s brilliant appearance and concentrated flavor make it ideal for applications where visual impact and flavor punctuation are paramount.

  • Live Garnish for Oyster Platters: The premier use - placed live on ice alongside oysters, then consumed as a palate-cleansing bite between shellfish varieties.
  • Soup and Broth Finisher: Added whole to clear consommés and bisques just before serving, where they provide both visual drama and bursts of sweet flavor.
  • Sushi and Sashimi Accent: Used as an elegant, edible decoration on sushi platters or as a tiny nigiri topping.
  • Crudo and Ceviche Component: Their small size and sweet flavor make them perfect for raw preparations, requiring no cutting or preparation.

3. The Harvest & Growth Cycle ‘Neri-Snack’ is a constant, efficient grazer that thrives in stable marine conditions. They reproduce in brackish water but grow best in full seawater, making them non-invasive in closed systems. In a Haloponic™ marine setup, a colony provides a continuous yield of 300-500 pristine snails per month from a 15-liter volume, reaching optimal size and flavor concentration of 1.8 cm in just 5-7 weeks while maintaining impeccable tank cleanliness.
